ygData.subject: Re: Train etiquette
ygData.msgSnippet: usually, it is the polite thing to ask if he wants help. If he doesn t say anything, and begins to drop below 40% health with a majority of the train still on
ygData.messageBody:
usually, it is the polite thing to ask if he
wants help. If he doesn't say anything, and begins to
drop below 40% health with a majority of the train
still on board, swing away. It may save his life, and
it will save anyone who is nearby that may have died
when he did.<br><br>and now... I have a
confession:<br>I killed a man.<br>I wasted a cleric.<br>Flat out
leveled him down to the ground.<br>I can't stand it, I
have to get it off my chest.<br>He was sitting too
near the gypsies in North Karana when the enchanter
one charmed me and went beserk. I had no idea, no
control. All I knew was my screen said, "You have slain
So-and-So" I thought OMG I killed a player... I soon snapped
out of my charm and wasted the gypsy, then cried over
the young cleric I had wasted. I tried to find him a
resurrection in the zone. I apologized profusely, and offered
him all the platinum I had on me in hopes he would
forgive me. If my memory was better, I would apologize
again now, but alas, my memory kinda bites. He took it
pretty well, and we laughed about it a little later. But
my hands have felt the blood of a player, and I am
scarred.<br><br>Nukai Oakenwulf<br>Cleric Hunter of Spiritus
Valorum<br>Master Potter, Brewer, and Drinker
